entry.title: Combined summary - BIP99 and Schism hardforks lifecycle (was Switching Bitcoin Core to sqlite db)
entry.summary: The email thread discussing the creation of a hardfork has caused Rusty Russell to warn developers about straying from the subject line and request redirection to bitcoin-discuss. Three contributors have been moderated as a result. Meanwhile, Jorge Timón and Peter R debate whether consensus rules can be broken and how users would react to a change in ownership. Timón argues that all users, including miners, have control over the rules their software validates, and no majority can force them to move to different rules. Corey Haddad's comment about the market being able to stop enforcing ownership is also discussed.
